sentence.Network_en: Butchers recommend cooking meat with the fat and trimming it away later.
sentence.Network_cn: 肉贩建议先把肉整个儿煮熟，然后再将肥肉切去。

entry.def: The trimming on something such as a piece of clothing is the decoration, for example along its edges, that is in a different colour or material.

example.ex: ...the lace trimming on her satin nightgown.
example.tran: 她缎子睡衣上的蕾丝花边

entry.tran: (切取所需部分以后的)下脚料，剩余物
entry.def: Trimmings are pieces of something, usually food, which are left over after you have cut what you need.

example.ex: Use any pastry trimmings to decorate the apples.
example.tran: 用剩余的油酥面皮装饰苹果。

entry.tran: 种种额外的东西;外加的种种配搭
entry.def: If you say that something comes with all the trimmings, you mean that it has many extra things added to it to make it more special.

example.ex: They were married with all the trimmings, soon after graduation.
example.tran: 他们毕业后不久就大操大办地结婚了。

example.ex: …a Thanksgiving dinner of turkey and all the trimmings.
example.tran: 有火鸡及各色配菜的感恩节大餐

sentences.sentence: "the children had to be in bed before it was time for the trimming of the tree"

means.word_mean: 2. a decoration or adornment on a garment;
